title: Conquest of the rivers
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Australian Alps (N.S.W. and Vic.)
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Snowy River Region (N.S.W. and Vic.)
Communications, Infrastructure, & Transport/Snowy Mountains Hydro-electric Scheme
Communications, Infrastructure, & Transport/Tunnels - Design and construction
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Rivers - Regulation
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Immigrants - Australia
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Migrant labor
description: Shows through the experiences of a new recruit to the Snowy Mountains Scheme how this great enterprise was carried out. There are dramatic scenes from inside the thirty-seven mile tunnel which is an essential feature of the work. Other views include the blasting of roads, dam-building, and the life of families in the new frontier towns of the Australian Alps. Uses archival footage.
